title: Summer Heat
descriptions:
In the languid summer of 2008, Summer Heat follows Eva, a restless college student who returns to her coastal hometown to care for her ailing father and help keep the family’s struggling beachside café afloat. The town is in a drought—water restrictions, brown lawns, and simmering tempers—and the heat wave becomes a pressure cooker for old resentments and new desires.

Eva reconnects with Marco, her high school boyfriend who never left and now works on a construction crew tasked with building luxury condos that threaten to displace longtime residents. She also befriends Lily, a charismatic photographer passing through town to document the drought, whose outsider’s eye reveals the quiet beauty and buried rot of the community. Drawn to Lily’s fearless energy, Eva begins to reevaluate the compromises she’s made and the life she thought she was returning to.

As the café’s finances worsen and her father refuses to sell, Eva is pulled into a civic battle between developers promising jobs and neighbors fighting to preserve the shoreline. Marco’s complicity with the construction project strains their romance, while Eva’s growing bond with Lily ignites a tender, complicated attraction that forces her to confront truths about herself she has long suppressed.

Wildfire smoke rolls in from the hills, turning the sky copper and pushing tensions to a breaking point. A late-night blackout triggers a chaotic beach party where long-simmering conflicts explode—old friends turn on each other, loyalties fracture, and Eva’s father collapses, forcing her to choose between escape and responsibility. In the aftermath, a sudden, blessed rainstorm brings relief and clarity. The condo deal falters, exposed by Lily’s photos and a community outcry, but nothing is unchanged.

By summer’s end, Eva decides to stay—not out of obligation, but to remake the café as a community hub and to chart a life that’s hers alone. Marco leaves town at last, chasing opportunity elsewhere, while Lily moves on to her next project, leaving behind a portfolio that captures a town on the cusp and a woman finding her voice. Summer Heat is a coming-of-age drama about desire, consequence, and the scorched paths we take to finally come home.
